Ramai Bahas Mobil Hibrida, Daihatsu Incar Model Paling Laku
04 Nov 2019, 12:22 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Rayhand Purnama Karim JP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- AstraÂ Daihatsu Motor (ADM) mengatakan siap masuk era elektrifikasi dengan menawarkan mobil hybrid sebelum memasarkan kendaraan listrik berbasis baterai di Indonesia.Direktur Marketing ADM Amelia Tjandra menjelaskan bahwa pihaknya masih menganalisa sebelum resmi menjual jenis kendaraan hybrid atau listrik. Menurut Amelia bila ADM punya pemikiran akan masuk ke segmen kendaraan ramah lingkungan yang paling digemari konsumen dalam negeri.Seperti diketahui regulasi pertama yang terbit Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) Nomor 55 Tahun 2019 tentang Percepatan Program Kendaraan Bermotor Listrik Berbasis Baterai Untuk Transportasi Jalan. Lalu mengikuti Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 73 Tahun 2019 tentang Barang Kena Pajak yang Tergolong Mewah Berupa Kendaraan Bermotor yang Dikenai Pajak Penjualan atas Barang Mewah (PPnBM) diundangkan bulan lalu."Nanti pada waktunya kami akan ikut. Sekarang (juklak-petunjuk pelaksanaan dan juknis-petunjuk teknis) itu belum keluar," kata Amelia di Sunter, Jakarta Utara pekan lalu."Biasanya ya Daihatsu itu mengeluarkan (produk) dengan mengadakan survei dahulu kendaraan jenis apa yang disukai (konsumen)," sambung Amelia kemudian.Berdasarkan data Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia (Gaikindo) penjualan mobil penumpang Daihatsu didominasi Multi Purpose Vehicle (MPV) dan Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV). Di segmen MPV ada Xenia dan mobil 'murah' Sigra, sedangkan kelas SUV ada Terios sebagai 'kembaran' Toyota Rush."Dunia sekarang condong ke SUV. Tapi saya belum bisa ngomong [hybrid Daihatsu SUV]. karena sampai hari ini belum buat rencana. Kami nunggu juklak dari menteri," ucap Amelia.Kerja sama Toyota-DaihatsuDaihatsu pernah mengungkap bila pengembangan hybrid di Indonesia menunggu instruksi induk perusahaan, yaitu Toyota. Sementara Toyota Indonesia sudah menyatakan komitmen melakukan produksi mobil hybrid di Tanah Air pada 2022.Produksi mobil ramah lingkungan disebutkan bakalan memanfaatkan fasilitas produksi yang sudah ada. Detail rencana itu hanya saja belum diungkap Toyota.Amelia menuturkan pihaknya menyambut baik bila Toyota sudah membuat rencana jangka panjang. Kendati demikian bagi Amelia itu belum final, sebab jika Daihatsu-Toyota 'diwajibkan' kerja sama di pasar lokal, artinya produk yang dihasilkan kedua perusahaan harus 'kembar', layaknya model-model mobil yang telah diserap konsumen di Indonesia.Dalam hal ini Toyota punya banyak produk MPV dari berbagai kelas mulai menengah ke bawah hingga premium. Begitu juga dengan produk SUV merek Toyota. Di sisi lain MPV dan SUV Daihatsu Indonesia produknya sangat terbatas."Dia [Toyota] MPV gede banyak ada yang gede mahal medium macam-macam. Kalau kami compact car. Kalau dia itu punya macam-macam. Nah yang mana (jenisnya) kamu tanya dong (ke Toyota)," ucap Amelia mengelak pertanyaan wartawan.(ryh/mik)

Crowded Discuss Hybrid Cars, Daihatsu Targeting Most Selling Models
Nov 04 2019, 12:22 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Rayhand Purnama Karim JP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) said it is ready to enter the era of electrification by offering hybrid cars before marketing battery-based electric vehicles in Indonesia. ADM Marketing Director Amelia Tjandra explained that they were still analyzing before officially selling hybrid or electric types of vehicles. According to Amelia, if ADM had a thought it would enter the environmentally friendly vehicle segment most favored by domestic consumers. As is known, the first regulation issued Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 55 of 2019 concerning the Acceleration of Battery-Based Electric Vehicle Vehicles for Road Transportation. Then following the Government Regulation (PP) Number 73 Year 2019 regarding Taxable Goods classified as Luxury in the form of Motorized Vehicles Charged Sales Sales Tax on Luxury Goods (PPnBM) promulgated last month. "Later in time we will participate. Now (operational guidelines and "The technical guidelines have not yet come out," Amelia said in Sunter, North Jakarta last week. "Usually, Daihatsu releases (the product) by conducting a survey of what type of vehicle (consumers) they prefer," Amelia continued later. The Indonesian Motor Vehicle Industry (Gaikindo) Daihatsu passenger car sales are dominated by Multi Purpose Vehicle (MPV) and Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV). In the MPV segment there are Xenia and 'cheap' Sigra cars, while the SUV class is Terios as the 'twin' Toyota Rush. "The world is now leaning towards SUVs. But I haven't been able to say [hybrid Daihatsu SUV], because to date I haven't made plans. We are waiting for the operational guidelines from the minister, "said Amelia. The Toyota-Daihatsu Daihatsu cooperation has revealed that hybrid development in Indonesia is waiting for instructions from its parent company, namely Toyota. While Toyota Indonesia has stated its commitment to produce hybrid cars in the country in 2022. The production of environmentally friendly cars is said to be utilizing existing production facilities. The details of the plan, however, have not yet been revealed by Toyota. Amelia said it welcomed it when Toyota made a long-term plan. However for Amelia it is not final, because if Daihatsu-Toyota is 'required' to work together in the local market, it means that the products produced by the two companies must be 'twins', like car models that have been absorbed by consumers in Indonesia. In this case Toyota has many MPV products from various classes ranging from middle to lower to premium. Likewise with Toyota brand SUV products. On the other hand, MPV and Daihatsu Indonesia's SUV products are very limited. "He [Toyota], MPV is big, there are many big, expensive kinds of mediums. If we are compact cars, if he has a variety. Now, which (type), you ask? please (to Toyota), "said Amelia dodging reporters' questions. (ryh / mik)
